title: Myelodysplastic syndrome
summary: A myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS) is one of a group of cancers in which immature blood cells in the bone marrow do not mature, so do not become healthy blood cells.[3] Early on, no symptoms typically are seen.[3] Later, symptoms may include feeling tired, shortness of breath, bleeding disorders, anemia, or frequent infections.[3] Some types may develop into acute myeloid leukemia.[3]
